title: AI Product Specialist to fast growing company
Business analysts, IT architects and transformation managers - Business & Technology Solutions (BTS)
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Business & Technology Solutions** 
 (BTS) is a key team within Capgemini, specializing in navigating our customers through the complexities and interdependencies that characterize large-scale technology-enabled transformation programs. Our team of experienced
 **business analysts** 
 ,
 **IT architects** 
 and
 **transformation managers** 
 , support our customers in designing, planning, and conducting digital transformations. We create a bridge between business objectives and the world of IT solutions that can help to achieve them. We’re striving to understand our customers business, current and future challenges, as well as their IT environment. We then propose, design, plan and help to implement new technological solutions or changes in the current IT landscape to improve or transform relevant processes. We often define requirements for new IT projects that are later implemented by other Capgemini units or external partners.
   

  

 We are hiring SME’s in one of the following verticals:
 **Retail** 
 ,
 **Auto** 
 or
 **Swedish Public Sector** 
 . If you’d like to join or know more, just apply – if suitable profile you’ll be invited to meet the team.
   

  

 Please note that Swedish language skills are mandatory to be excellent both spoken and written.
   

  

**BTS Supports Its Clients Through**
* The right people: consultants with in-depth process and benefits management knowledge who combine that with excellent program and client management skills to enable and accelerate the delivery of value from large-scale technology-enabled transformation programs
* The right methods: a methodology that integrates all elements of the delivery of technology-enabled transformation into one holistic approach
* The right process: a series of tools and techniques that enable effective and efficient execution of a customer's technology-enabled transformation programs, thus securing both sustained change and the delivery of business benefits


**What Capgemini BTS Stands For**
* We’re ambitious for our business, our clients and our people;
* We’re all about specialism and deep expertise: work with the best, be the best;
* Innovation is at the core of what we do. It’s in our approach, our methodologies and in our commitment to professional development;
* Through innovation, we want to make our mark on technology transformation – collectively and individually;
* We believe that the best teams are diverse, where different cultures, and varied personal and professional experience come together;
* We deliver IT-enabled business transformation and change around: Organizational Change Management, Process Consulting, IT Transformation, Architecture & Technical Leadership, Program Leadership & Project Management Office (PMO).


 As a Senior consultant in Digital Transformation, you work with some of our customers within the Public sector, Retail or Auto industry. You’ll play a leading role in complex client projects at the intersection of business and IT, advising and supporting our clients in their digital transformation. You develop the digital potential of the customers and drive forward decisive innovations in order to actively shape the digital transformation in the context of Public sector, Retail or Auto -specific problems. You will develop sustainable IT solutions with us based on business requirements and equip our customers for the future.
   

  

**The responsibilities will vary from project to project, you will for example:**
* Act as Subject Matter Expert within your area of expertise and advise and support with regard to digital transformation.
* Design and implement technology solutions enabling business to take advantage of our customers current and emerging opportunities, i.e. be part of developing, implementing, and improving business processes.
* Support our sales organization in shaping and advising on new deals.
* You analyze and identify optimization and innovation potential based on current trends in the industry and map these into future-proof IT solutions.
* With your individual strengths and your professional expertise, you will work on the further development of our service portfolio.


**Your daily tasks**
* leading consulting, IT transformation and roll-out projects for our customers,
* organizing and moderating meetings and workshops with customers representatives where you will get to know their current and future challenges as well as collect and structure requirements resulting from them,
* analyzing, modeling, and identifying improvements of business processes as well as in IT systems and environments in order to propose and design changes and optimizations,
* cooperating with customers, technology experts and development teams to design new technology solutions or changes in existing IT systems and environments,
* defining requirements and creating specifications for new IT systems or changes and transformation of existing IT landscapes,
* presenting and discussing your solution ideas with diverse groups of stakeholders to win their acceptance and commitment,
* identifying opportunities for business development and new projects, as well as contributing to new offers for our clients,
* supporting and mentoring less experienced consultants and leading consulting teams.


**What You'll Bring**
* You have several years of experience, preferably from consulting in one of the following vertical: Public sector, Retail or Auto companies, e.g. as a business analyst, process manager, enterprise manager, in requirements management or in project management.
* You are characterized by your experience/interest in business development and sales, your focus on results, your strategic thinking, your high level of self-motivation and customer orientation.
* You are a strong communicator who understands the importance of fostering relationships with business and IT stakeholders, you are comfortable working in a mixed client and Capgemini agile environment – and have a good level of Swedish both spoken and written.


**What We Offer**
 We will provide you with intense professional development and as much stretch as you need to put your skills into action, learn and progress. You will have the opportunity for:
   

  

* Acceleration: The opportunity to accelerate your career through intellectual challenge, stretch and responsibility
* Collaboration: The opportunity to work as part of a high performing, supportive and friendly team that values close collaboration with customers
* Satisfaction: Swiftly add value and make a real difference to Capgemini and to our customers organizations


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
   

  

*Please note that all applicants must be fluent in Swedish.*
*For more information, please mail bts\_se\_recruitment@capgemini.com*

title: Technical Writer
description:
**About Keyfactor**
 Our mission is to build a connected society, rooted in trust, with identity-first security for every machine and human. Keyfactor helps organizations move fast to establish digital trust at scale — and then maintain it. With decades of cybersecurity experience, Keyfactor is trusted by more than 1,500 companies across the globe. We are proud to continually earn recognition as a Best Place to Work, and we achieve that through our amazing people who cultivate our culture as we grow. We hope you will trust your future with Keyfactor!
   

  

**Title:** 
 Technical Writer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Experience:** 
 Mid-Senior level
   

  

**Job Function:** 
 Information Technology
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Computer and Network Security
   

  

**About The Position**
 Are you a master of words with a passion for technology? Do you thrive on making complex concepts simple and accessible and want to work with dedicated people? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

 As a Technical Writer, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between our advanced technology and our users and partners. You will be responsible for creating clear, concise, and user-friendly documentation that empowers our customers and supports our products. Join us in crafting informative guidance whether it is for our sales department, implementation, integration, or training purposes. Your work will ensure that our technology is accessible and understandable for everyone.
   

  

**The position is based in Stockholm office, follows hybrid work model with excellent flexible working practices. Applicants must hold a valid Right to Work in Sweden.**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Create and maintain Product Documentation: Develop comprehensive, accurate, and engaging documentation for our products, including how-to guides, technical specifications, and installation instructions.
* Gather and analyze Information: Gather and analyze technical information from various sources and stakeholders to document new or improved product functionality.
* Collaborate with Teams: Work closely with engineers, product managers, technical writers, product marketing, and others, to coordinate product documentation over multiple parallel projects and teams.
* Simplify Complex Concepts: Translate technical jargon into clear, easy-to-understand language that resonates with our diverse audience.
* Ensure Consistency and Quality: Maintain a consistent voice and style across all documentation, adhering to company guidelines and industry best practices.
* Assist in Planning and Scheduling: Assist in planning, scheduling, and tracking documentation work to meet product release dates and client deliverables.
* Take Ownership: Be the point of contact for all documentation projects, ensuring timely delivery and high quality standards.
* Continuous Improvement: Contribute to enhancing documentation processes, standards, and methodologies, aiming for greater efficiency and effectiveness.


**Skills And Qualifications**
* Superior command of the English language, with clear, concise, and engaging writing.
* Strong understanding of technical concepts and the ability to learn new technologies quickly. Preferably from container solutions and Kubernetes.
* Eye for detail, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all documentation.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment and communicate with diverse groups of stakeholders.
* Proven ability to take ownership of projects and deliver high-quality results on time.
* Work proactively and courageously, taking initiative to identify documentation needs and tackle challenges head-on.
* Familiarity with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and software development processes.
* Previous experience in technical writing or a related field is required.
* Degree in Computer Science or another relevant technical subject would be preferred.
* Experience in IT security, PKI and open-source software concepts is highly desirable.


**Compensation**
 Salary will be commensurate with experience.
   

  

**Culture, Career Opportunities And Benefits**
 We build teams that continually strive to get better than the day before. You will be challenged daily and given opportunities to grow personally and professionally. We balance autonomy and structure to create an entrepreneurial environment to spur creativity and new ideas.
   

  

 Here are just some of the initiatives that make our culture special:
   

  

* Second Fridays (a company-wide day off on the second Friday of every month).
* Comprehensive benefit coverage, paid for by the company for you and your dependents (US).
* Generous paid parental leave (US).
* Dedicated employee-focused ambassadors via Key Contributors & Culture Committees.
* DIVERSE Commitment, a call to action for a more inclusive and diverse future in business, society, and technology.
* The Keyfactor Alliance Program to support DEIB efforts.
* Wellbeing resources, wellness allowance, mindfulness app free membership, Wellness Wednesdays.
* Global Volunteer Day, company non-profit matching, and 3 volunteer days off.
* Unlimited time off (US) and competitive time off globally.
* Monthly Talent development and Cross Functional meetings to support professional development.
* Regular All Hands meetings – followed by group gatherings.


**Our Core Values**
 Our core values are extremely important to how we run our business and what we look for in every team member:
   

  

**Trust** 
**is paramount.** 
  

  

*We deliver security software and solutions where trust and openness are of the highest importance for our customers. We are honest and a trusted partner in every aspect of business.*
**Customers** 
**are core.** 
  

  

*We strategize, operate, and execute through a customer-centric view. We prioritize the security interests of our customers, and we act as if their data were our own.*
**Innovation** 
**never stops, it only accelerates.** 
  

  

*The speed of change is accelerating. We are committed, through investment and focus, to stay ahead of the innovation curve.*
**We deliver with** 
**agility** 
**.** 
  

  

*We thrive in high-paced and continually changing environments. We navigate through newly added variables, adjust accordingly, while driving towards our strategic goals.*
**United by** 
**respect** 
**.** 
  

  

*Respect for all is what unites us. We promote diversity, inclusivity, equity, and acting with empathy and openness, both in our business and in our communities.*
**Teams** 
**make “it” happen.** 
  

  

*Vision and goals are not individually achievable – they require teamwork. We pride ourselves in operating as a cohesive team, creating promoters and partners, and winning as one.*
  

  

**Keyfactor is a proud equal opportunity employer.** 
  

  

**REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION:** 
 Applicants with disabilities may contact a member of Keyfactor’s People team via people@keyfactor.com and/or telephone at 1.216.785.2990 to request and arrange for accommodations at any time.
   

  

**Keyfactor Privacy Notice**

title: 2025 Global Private Bank - Advisor Analyst Training Program - Stockholm
Group Accountant
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers - no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses - including many of the world's largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
   

  

 We dream big - for our company, our customers and our employees - and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries - probably somewhere near you!
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced Group Accountant to join our dynamic and ambitious team of 4 group accountants with various levels of seniority and expertise and report to CAO. The Group Accounting team is responsible for the consolidation of global financial reporting and for providing financial data on consolidated level and ensure timely, accurate and uniform data to internal and external parties.
   

  

 The position is based in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö, but with the possibility to work 100 % remote.
   

  

****The essence of the role****
 As our new Group Accountant, you'll team up with colleagues from various business units around the globe, sharing your financial expertise and insights. You'll define reporting requirements for our group companies, engage in the development process, and be a valuable advisor and conversational partner on all things related to reporting and consolidation.
   

  

**As Our New Group Accountant, You Will**
* Prepare group monthly financial closings
* Prepare group account reconciliations
* Improve efficiency in monthly closing process
* Review and analyse subsidiary monthly financial reporting
* Prepare Group Annual Report and Quarterly Reports
* Have extensive contact with subsidiaries
* Guide the organisation on accounting related matters
* Contribute to a variety of tasks commonly found in a collaborative accounting department


****Who are you?****
 We're looking for a friendly and proactive team player who excels in communication skills. It's important for this role to have a holistic mindset and strong analytical abilities. You bring a flexible attitude, embracing changes with ease, and you thrive in a dynamic environment. Whether working independently or as part of a team, you're excited to contribute to our thrilling journey ahead.
   

  

 It's a plus if you have experience in mergers and acquisitions or integrations, as well as experience in a global high-growth company. You are well-organized and eager to plan and enhance work process efficiencies. You take joy in helping your colleagues improve their skills. In this central role, building relationships, effective communication, and fostering trust are essential for success.
   

  

**In order to be successful in this role, we believe you have:**
* University degree in Finance, Business Administration or equivalent education
* At a minimum 5 years relevant experience from similar tasks at a Group Accounting Department
* Strong IFRS accounting knowledge
* Strong experience in excel
* Strong analytical skills
* Experienced user of Finance Systems
* User experience in consolidation tool AARO is an additional bonus
* You may have previously worked either at subsidiary level or at group level


 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English.**
 Are you ready? Join us on our journey!
   

  

**About The Recruitment Process**
 To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, experience, and attributes relevant to the role and Sinch will be assessed. As part of our recruitment process, pre-employment testing is used to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role. We acknowledge that there are two parties deciding in this process and welcome you to ask any questions you may have at any stage of the process.

title: Senior IT-controller till Agria
description:
*Vi söker nu en Senior IT-controller till Agria Djurförsäkring. Har du stor erfarenhet av finansiell styrning och arbete med controlling av IT-verksamhet? Brinner du för att driva utveckling och med din kompetens bidra till hög kvalitet inom IT- och utveckling? Delar du dessutom vårt intresse för djur? Då kan du vara den vi söker. Välkommen med din ansökan!*
**Om jobbet**
 Agria Djurförsäkring siktar mot att bli Europas största djurförsäkringsbolag. Det innebär också en spännande utvecklingsresa mot en modern och framtidssäkrad IT.
   

  

 Som senior IT-controller har du en nyckelroll i att bidra till att våra strategiska initiativ levereras kostnadseffektivt och med största värde för affären. Du driver utvecklingen av den ekonomiska styrningen och skapar förutsättningar för optimering och styrning av it- och utvecklingsresurser och bidrar till Agrias mål att bli Europas ledande djurförsäkringsbolag!
   

  

 Du ingår i gruppen Control & Analys inom CFO-avdelningen och har ett mycket nära samarbete med Utvecklingsavdelningen.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden är:
   

  

* Utveckla och implementera väl fungerande ekonomiska processer för kontroll och styrning av IT-kostnader och investeringar
* Proaktivt analysera och verka för effektivitet inom it- och utvecklingsverksamheten
* Ta fram tydlig finansiell rapportering till ledningen och andra intressenter och underlag för strategiska beslut.
* Leda plan- och prognosprocesser för utvecklingsavdelningen i nära samarbete med övriga controllers
* Samarbeta med Lean Portfolio Management för att optimera resursallokeringen
* Utföra kostnads-nyttoanalyser för IT-initiativ och investeringar samt ta fram underlag för aktivering och ekonomisk redovisning
* Säkerställa framtagande och uppföljning av lean business case för våra större utvecklingsinitiativ och transformationsprogram


**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i din roll ser vi att du:
   

  

* Har relevant akademisk examen
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av controlling av IT-verksamhet inom såväl linjeverksamhet som portfölj och transformation
* Är van att hantera stora datamängder och avancerad användning av excel
* Har erfarenhet av att driva processförbättringar inom control
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i lean-agila miljöer, gärna med kunskap om SAFe
* Behärskar såväl svenska som engelska väl i både tal och skrift


 Som person är du självgående och arbetar självständigt. Samtidigt trivs du med att samarbeta med andra för att uppnå gemensamma mål. Du har en stark analytisk förmåga och mycket god kommunikationsförmåga. Du har förmåga att se helheten och hur olika delar samverkar – eller motverkar varandra.
   

  

**Om oss**
*Välkommen till Agria Djurförsäkring – en plats* 
*där vi skapar trygghet för djur och människor. Allt vi gör, gör vi för djuren. Det genomsyrar hela vår medarbetarkultur och märks i alla beslut vi fattar. Vi tror på att människor med en genuin passion för djur är nyckeln till att förmedla vårt erbjudande och att upprätthålla våra mål, mission och löften.*
*Vi vill bidra till en kreativ och lärande miljö där du som vill utveckla dig själv och verksamheten ska kunna göra det. En miljö där vi som arbetsgivare ger dig rätt stöd och ledarskap. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsplats att trivas i och vi välkomnar alla, oavsett bakgrund.*
 Agria växer i Europa och har idag verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike, Irland och Nederländerna. På Agria arbetar cirka 650 medarbetare. I koncernen ingår även dotterbolaget Agria Vet Guide som erbjuder digital veterinärrådgivning.
   

  

*Var med oss på resan att skapa Europas största och mest valbara djurförsäkringsbolag för att skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor.*
**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-06**

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

 Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!
   

  

**Introduction**
 The Customer Success Manager (CSM) is the key partner helping customers achieve their strategic objectives and extract maximum value from their investment in our products. CSMs drive adoption, retention and expansion of our products and services by being a trusted advisor to our customers. They are experts on our products and technology, digital strategy and on growing a culture of harmonizing, understanding, and acting on digital data. CSMs accomplish this by being empathetic and seeking to understand our customers' challenges and needs and respond with a problem-solving mindset. By relying on past experience, business acumen, and technical aptitude, CSMs are the driving force that enable our customers to unlock their digital potential. Additionally, the CSM serves as the liaison between us and the customer – facilitating collaboration with Product, Engineering, Sales, Professional Services and others to be the voice of the customer within our company.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* In partnership with Account Executives, own the overall relationship with assigned clients in a blended portfolio of 25-40 customers, focusing on: growing adoption and ensuring retention, expansion and satisfaction.
* Work with customers to build and execute on a success plan that establishes critical goals and key performance indicators.
* Ensure customers adopt best practices for both running their digital program and in using our platform.
* Support the development of the Customer Success Management team by mentoring and inspiring fellow CSMs through example and professional and personal experiences.
* Drive accountability for deliverables internally and among customer and partner teams.
* Assess and provide perspective on customer challenges related to technical implementation, marketing strategy and building a culture of harmonizing, understanding, and acting on digital data.
* Through regularly conducted touchpoints, establish a trusted/strategic advisor relationship with assigned customers and drive continued value of our solution and services.
* Coordinate appropriate resources for each meeting to obtain the desired outcome. Being able to drive meetings forward in a confident but humble manner.
* Identify and develop opportunities for new/improved usage of our products across organizational functions and business units. This will include conducting simple product demos and run-throughs of out of the box product functionality.
* Manage account issues and escalations, both internally and with partner teams.
* Maintain and continuously improve your own current functional knowledge and technical knowledge of our platform, internal processes and relationship building.
* Collect product feedback and advocate for customer needs within the company.
* Collaborate with marketing teams on customer advocacy activities such as events and case studies.
* Ability to confidently present our product roadmap and new features, being able to log in to a demo account to showcase simple features in the CMS/Commerce tool.
* Stay on top of industry news, technology products, platforms and partners to provide and maintain a deep industry and ecosystem expertise.


**Knowledge And Experience**
* 5+ years of experience in a related function with direct customer contact and engagement experience, in a pre-sale, post-sale or professional services function, preferably at a SaaS- or Paas-based company.
* Prior experience in a Customer Success Manager Role or equivalent with a history of increasing satisfaction, adoption, and retention.
* Familiarity working with clients of all sizes and industries, private and public sector.
* Experience working with web or mobile app product and development teams, plus external technology and/or development partner teams.
* Experience with content management systems (CMS), digital marketing platforms, e-commerce platforms, and a real passion for new technologies.
* Project and stakeholder management experience & skills.
* Renewal processes and strong negotiation skills are big plusses.
* Technical account manager or solution architect background also a plus.
* Fluency in English & Swedish is a must-have


**Education**
 Bachelors degree and preferably further professional training in previous role
   

  

**Competencies**
 Establishing Relationships
   

  

 Navigating Organizations
   

  

 Prioritizing and Organizing Work
   

  

 Making Convincing Arguments
   

  

 Negotiating Agreements
   

  

 Our culture is the most important thing we offer. We continuously aim to provide a high-growth space, both virtually and in person, where you can do your best work and, in the process, unlock your boundless potential. We are dedicated to providing meaningful rewards and development opportunities for our employees, recognizing performance and creating a supportive working environment.
   

  

 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
   

  

 At Optimizely, our standardized language is English, and it is crucial to have good English communication skills to be successful in your global role. All our external and cross-location communication is done in US English (en-us), but internally you can speak in whichever native language you most identify with.

title: Teknisk Business Analyst
description:
*Vill du vara en del av vår resa mot agila arbetsmetoder? Fondliv söker en driven Business Analyst med Lumera erfarenhet för att vara en länk mellan verksamheten och IT-utveckling. Bli en del av Sveriges största aktör på pensionsmarknaden och möt nya marknadsförutsättningar. Ansök idag!*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som Business Analyst kommer dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden att vara:
   

  

* Fungera som en viktig länk mellan verksamheten och IT-utveckling, där du säkerställer att båda parter förstår och kommunicerar behoven och kraven på ett effektivt sätt.
* Hantera incidenter för vårt Produktsystem och säkerställa snabb och korrekt åtgärd för att minimera störningar och maximera användarnas upplevelse.
* Tillhandahålla verksamhetsorienterad support, där du hjälper användare att förstå och använda systemet på bästa sätt för att uppnå sina mål och behov.
* Ge användarstöd mot interna användare, där du svarar på frågor, löser problem och ger vägledning för att säkerställa en smidig och effektiv användarupplevelse.


**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll önskar vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Starkt intresse och driv att arbeta i gränslandet mellan IT och verksamhet samt goda kunskaper om produkt och försäkringar.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Lumera och kunskap om dess funktioner och användning.
* Tidigare erfarenhet inom livbranschen och god förståelse för dess specifika behov och utmaningar.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med SAFe eller liknande agila arbetssätt.


 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, självledande och ansvarsfull. Du är en god lagspelare som trivs med att dela med dig av din kompetens och arbeta i högt tempo. Du tar ett helhetsansvar för att få saker gjorda med hög kvalitet och tar dig an nya utmaningar med en positiv inställning. Som kommunikatör är du lyhörd och har förmågan att skapa goda relationer med dina kollegor och våra kunder.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Fondliv planerar stora tekniska förändringar och du kommer att vara en viktig del av denna utveckling. Vi erbjuder spännande utmaningar och möjligheter att utvecklas genom att byta till Lumera. Du får även möjlighet att påverka och skapa nya arbetssätt och processer. Fondliv är en av Sveriges största aktörer på pensionsmarknaden med fokus på hållbarhet och samhällsengagemang. Vår arbetsmiljö präglas av tätt samarbete och högt uppsatta mål inom ett lean-agilt arbetssätt.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-08**

title: Rekryterare till Framtiden Stockholm
description:
Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet inom rekrytering och är redo att utvecklas ytterligare i rollen! Du bli en del av en grupp där teamwork, engagemang och gemenskap står i fokus! Här får du arbeta mot en bredd av företag i en varierande rekryteringsroll.
   

  

 Detta är ett vikariat för föräldraledig kollega. Perioden är omgående till jan 2026, med god möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Som rekryterare hos oss på Framtiden får du vara med och hjälpa andra personer att hitta sitt drömjobb eller sin nästa kollega. Du kommer att ha en varierad vardag där du ansvarar över hela rekryteringsprocessen, från kravprofilsmöte och annonsering till intervjuer och avtalsskrivning.
   

  

 I rollen ingår rådgivning till våra kunder, kandidater och konsulter för att säkerhetsställa en professionell rekryteringsprocess och en bra arbetsplats. Vi är måna om att våra kandidater, konsulter och kunder är nöjda med det vi levererar!
   

  

**OM DIG**
 Vi söker dig som älskar att jobba mot uppsatta mål och trivs att arbeta i ett högt tempo. Du gillar att få strukturera upp och driva egna processer samt att arbeta med frihet under ansvar. Det är samtidigt viktigt för dig att jobba nära dina kollegor för att bolla idéer, utbyta kunskaper och att ha kul på jobbet! Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper i denna rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

**För att du ska lyckas och trivas i rollen som rekryterare ser vi att du har:**
* Erfarenhet av rekrytering inom bemanningsbranschen
* Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* B-körkort


 Det är ett
 *extra plus* 
 om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av rekrytering inom IT/Teknik
* Erfarenhet av försäljning


**OM FRAMTIDEN**
 Framtiden arbetar med både bemanning och rekrytering, vi vill göra skillnad i människors liv. Vi gör skillnad genom att hjälpa människor att hitta rätt jobb och rätt kollega. Vi är specialister på att rekrytera talanger till rätt företag främst inom IT/Teknik, ekonomi och kontor. Framtiden finns på sju orter i Sverige samt i Oslo.
   

  

 Som medarbetare på Framtiden skall det vara roligt att gå till jobbet! Vi är ett ambitiöst och härligt gäng som gillar att umgås med varandra och samtidigt alltid vill utvecklas tillsammans. Här strävar vi alltid efter att bli vårt bästa jag genom utbildning, träning och ständig utveckling i våra roller.
   

  

 För oss på Framtiden är balansen mellan jobb och privatliv viktigt, därför tillämpar vi förtroendetid och flexibel arbetsplats. Vi har också väl tilltaget friskvårdsbidrag och gemensam frukost varje dag.
   

  

 Vi står för hög service, kvalitet och har ett klimat som är familjärt och grundat i sunda värderingar. Om du vill ha en arbetsplats präglad av en positiv kultur där vi, medarbetarna, är i fokus är Framtiden rätt ställe för dig.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocess**
 Vår rekryteringsprocess kommer bestå av följande steg:
   

  

* CV-granskning
* Telefonintervju
* Personlighets- och logiktest
* Kompetensbaserad intervju med rekryterare
* Referenstagning
* Intervju med chef


**Övrig information**
 Omfattning: Heltid, vikariat till jan 2026
   

  

 Start: Omgående
   

  

 Ort: Stockholm
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Head of Product for Blockchain Project
description:
If you are passionate about privacy, transparency, whisteblowing and the power of decentralized technology to drive social impact, this might be for you!
 




  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Define and execute the product roadmap, aligning it with the company's mission and user needs. Ensure product features address the pain points of whistleblowers and activists.
* Design an intuitive, secure, and user-friendly interface for the platform. Optimize the entire user journey, from onboarding to ongoing interaction, ensuring a frictionless experience.
* Collaborate with the team to ensure smooth execution of the product vision. Balance technical requirements with a focus on creating a user-centered product.
* Work with the team to ensure that the product’s features and UX align with the overall go-to-market strategy, building trust with the user base.
* Conduct user research to understand the specific needs and behaviors of the platform’s target users. Use this feedback to continually iterate on the product and improve user satisfaction.
* Stay informed of the latest trends in blockchain, decentralized applications (dApps), and privacy-enhancing technologies to ensure the project remains at the forefront of innovation.
* Collaborate with the team to implement decentralized governance mechanisms (DAO) and content moderation strategies that align with project values of transparency and privacy.



  





**What You'll Need:** 



* 5+ years of experience in product management and product dev, with a focus on digital products and user experience.
* Strong background in designing intuitive, user-centric interfaces and optimizing user journeys for non-technical users.
* Experience using data to inform product decisions and prioritize features for maximum impact.
* Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and align product goals with business and technical requirements.
* Solid understanding of decentralized technologies, blockchain, and privacy-enhancing protocols, with experience in productizing these technologies.
* Experience working in or founding a startup, with the ability to adapt quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment.



  





**Bonus points for:** 



* Prior experience in blockchain or Web3 projects, with knowledge of decentralized governance and dApps.
* Experience designing secure platforms for sensitive information, with a focus on privacy and encryption.
* Knowledge of decentralized storage (e.g., IPFS), smart contracts, or token-based ecosystems.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Equity in a mission-driven company focused on driving transparency and social impact.
* The opportunity to build a platform that can empower whistleblowers and change the way sensitive information is shared globally.
* Flexibility and autonomy to shape the platform’s vision and roadmap from the ground up.
* A dynamic, remote-friendly work environment with passionate co-founders.



  





 If you’re excited about the potential of blockchain technology to safeguard truth and protect whistleblowers, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Product Owner - Parking Solutions
description:
*We have embarked on an exciting journey to become the most attractive partner in mobility. Our goal is to contribute to healthy and sustainable social development by offering mobility services that make cities smarter and everyday life easier.*
**About The Job**
 As a
 **Product Owner** 
 at Aimo, you will be an integral part of our dynamic team, contributing to the entire lifecycle of product and service development in our ever-evolving business landscape. You will collaborate with other Product Owners, Aimo Business representatives, the IT leadership team, and skilled developers located across multiple locations in the Nordics and Europe. Aimo fosters a product and developer culture rooted in servant leadership and a 'You Build It, You Run It' mindset.
   

  

 Our agile approach, featuring two-week sprints, sprint demos, and close collaboration with the business, ensures a fast-paced and innovative environment. Join us and play a pivotal role in Aimo's digitalization journey.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Be involved in every stage of new product development, from ideation and testing to implementation and ownership.
* Cultivate a curious mindset around new ideas and technologies.
* Act as a coach and Product Owner within a great team, taking ownership of the backlog for dedicated solutions, such as Free Flow/ANPR (automatic number plate recognition) solutions, Charge Point integrations, Barrier solutions, and more.
* Ensure the team applies best practices and design patterns to create scalable and secure solutions that meet technical performance requirements, fulfill business needs, and follow architectural models and guidelines.
* Continuously gather business needs and support the creation of business requirements across all three countries, translating them into effective, feasible, and viable solutions.
* Contribute to the development of customer-facing services, including web, app, and core parking platform features that support parking and EV charging.


**About You**
 This role offers a unique opportunity to take responsibility and deliver tangible business value while working closely with customers and the business. To excel in this position, you should have a curious, can-do attitude, be effective at troubleshooting, and communicate fluently in English.
   

  

**Experience in a startup environment or familiarity with lean startup and design thinking methodologies is a significant plus.**
 Must-Haves:
   

  

* Experience in building digital products from scratch.
* Experience with a full ecosystem of digital solutions, where integrations are essential.
* Experience with products and solutions involving high transaction volumes.


 Good to Have:
   

  

* Mobile app development experience (e.g., React Native).
* Experience working within an Agile delivery model and using supporting tools such as Atlassian software (e.g., Jira, Confluence).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience in a similar business or with solutions where physical and digital elements connect to create an excellent customer experience (CX).


 Application
   

  

**Please submit your application in English, including both your resume and responses to the application questions.**
**About Us**
 Aimo is owned by the Japanese company Sumitomo Corporation. With a focus on innovation and human needs, Sumitomo continuously develops new mobility solutions and innovations that make people's everyday lives easier.
   

  

**This role is based at our headquarters in Stockholm, and you must be able to be on-site when business needs require it.**
 Aimo is embarking on an exciting transformation as we strive to become the most innovative company in the industry. Join us and be part of creating something new!

title: Senior Test Engineer to a MedTech-company!
description:
Do you have previous experience in mechanical testing and test methods and a keen interest in the MedTech industry? Then this is the right opportunity for you! We are currently helping our client in finding their next Senior Test Engineer. When you step into our client's impressive facilities, you can feel the future and the shared passion the company has for creating products that improve people's health. As a project manager, you will be involved in driving their internal projects of medical technology products. Interested? Apply NOW!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Nacka, Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 We are looking for someone with a degree in mechanical, material or biomedical engineering, as well as previous experience with mechanical testing, developing test methods and working in a lab environment. In the role as Senior Test Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the robustness and compliance of medical device designs through rigorous assessments and innovative testing methods.
 


  


 You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, serve as a subject matter expert in test case design, and apply statistical problem-solving techniques to drive continuous improvement.
 


  


 The assignment is initially for 6 months with opportunities for extension.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An exciting assignment alongside colleagues from different parts of the world, where you work in a team with ambitious and talented colleagues with diverse backgrounds.
  
* The opportunity to contribute to the development of high-quality medical devices that meet stringent industry standards.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Ensure robust medical device designs through early and rigorous design assessments.
  
* Ensure compliance with engineering principles, company standards, customer requirements, and related specifications.
  
* Develop test methods for design assessment, verification and high-volume production, including test design and mechanical/dynamical fixture development.
  
* Write and execute design assessment and engineering test protocols; analyze data and author test reports for the design history file.
  
* Apply statistical methods and problem-solving techniques (e.g., fishbone diagrams, 5 Whys, DMAIC) in investigations and experimental work.
  
* Support the development of innovative methods and models to assess device robustness.
  

  


**We are looking for**

 You who:
 


  

  
* Have a Master’s degree in Mechanical-, Material-, and, Biomedical Engineering or similar
  
* Have approximately 5 years of experience in test method development, laboratory testing and statistical principles/tools and statistics software in a global matrix organization as well as in a regulated industry (such as the Life-Science industry or automotive industry)
  
* Have experience working with injection molded plastics
  
* Experience writing verification test plans and protocols, and completing test reports and working knowledge of regulations and standards such as : 21 CFR Part 820, ISO 13485, ISO 11608, ISO 14971
  
* Are fluent in English, as daily communication in English is required
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-sufficient
  
* Innovative
  
* Communicative
  
* Quality-oriented
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Cassandra Martinsson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107857

title: Senior Javautvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker en Senior Javautvecklare med primärt fokus på vår kunds Keycloak-baserade Identity and Access Management (IAM) lösning.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Java / Java Spring Boo
* Identity and Access Management-lösninga
* Keycloak


**Meriterande**
* OAUTH2/OIDC/SAML
* DevOps
* Docker/Containers
* AWS
* Kubernetes


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 31-10-2024
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, AI, Machine Learning, Test, Cloud, Infra DevOps, , IT-Projektledning.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Associate Consultant Coordinator to international fashion company!
Global Mobility Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you our new Global Mobility Manager who is able to tackle ambiguity analytically within our global mobility team while you enjoy an international environment as part of your daily work? Do you want to work with a versatile scope of global mobility topics with a specific focus on compliance and help us continue building the best global people practices? If so, then we’d love to talk.
   

  

**Role Background**
 As part of our phenomenal growth, we’re now looking to strengthen and scale our people team to own specific compliance pieces in our global mobility team. To do so, we need a person who looks beyond traditional mobility in favor of something to support growth in a way that ensures we are doing the right thing. Be it traditional international assignments and permanent transfers, serving our business with cross-border commuters, frequent business trips, and expansion, or remote work abroad.
   

  

 While you work as part of our global mobility team, you should be comfortable in rolling up your sleeves to get things done around all corners of Wolt across all our 27+ locations, and with our key stakeholders in your area of expertise be those internal or external.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Having end-to-end ownership of global mobility compliance, ensuring adherence to regulations across areas like mobile employee tax, payroll, immigration, and EU posting of workers. For example, you’ll be independently managing all aspects of mobile employee tax compliance, including tax policy process, vendor management, and ensuring accurate payroll and tax filings for cross-border employees, while you support our business to grow.
* While doing this you proactively diagnose, define, execute, and develop things in your respective remit for which you find the right balance between specific requirements, data, and common sense. As there is no one way of doing this, you can solve things creatively amid ambiguity.
* Work will be often done together with our vendors as well as the rest of the global mobility team, and key cross-functional teams tax, payroll, equity, finance, and legal teams where you work as a PM for your area of expertise while driving other stakeholders forward in their work. This means you will be communicating with a lot of stakeholder management while being able to independently drive impact for your work with the help of other cross-functional owners. Mentoring your team and cross-functional teams in your area of expertise is part of your daily work.
* While having the responsibility of determining, designing, and implementing preferred practices in use for immigration compliance, cross-border tax and payroll processes (both including equity), and reporting requirements, you focus on making sure we scale and move with speed from A to B to C and Z in situations where you don't have too much time in your hands. In practice your key cross-functional stakeholders live in their respective organizations while you move people forward, connect the dots in ambiguity, ensure the right decisions are made, and ensure global mobility compliance is handled effectively. Thinking ahead is something you do daily while guiding other team members in their work.
* You are responsible for implementing our global mobility team's yearly clock, monitoring and ensuring key compliance milestones are met on time, development activities for mobility compliance, and being the first point of contact to key business and internal stakeholders as well as external vendors in your areas of expertise. Regular audits and risk management will be owned by you in this role. As we don’t have everything in place when you join, you have a habit of rolling up your sleeves, getting to the bottom of what needs to be prioritized, and getting stuff done strategically.
* Defining and working on strategic compliance projects in supporting our business is your most critical area of ownership as well as different projects we work across Wolt and DoorDash.
* Having versatile scope within your area of expertise with a project type of approach. There may be things that come up so you are the Swiss army knife in taking up these challenges together with our global team.
* You find a balance between when to focus on the big picture and when to step in. You handle both with ease and are not afraid to get your hands dirty while keeping a broader goal and strategy in mind for compliance.


**Our humble expectations**
* We're looking for an analytical, strategic individual who is excited to dive in and drive. Extensive experience in global mobility compliance, including expat payroll, immigration, tax, social security, and equity, with a proven ability to interpret complex regulatory requirements and apply them in a business context will take you far while you’ll learn how we work as we go. This means that a background in consulting, tax, legal and/or compliance with 6+ years is where we are aiming!
* Extremely strong stakeholder management skills topped with analytical skills including ability to figure out ambiguous data sets and make complex subject matter topics meaningful for any audience. This means that you are a natural problem solver but also extremely strong in communicating complicated things in a very simple manner for your team, vendors, business and senior leadership.
* This is a complex landscape and so, in this role you naturally use your judgment to ensure we are able to make the right decisions while setting criteria and goals for us to move forward. And thus, you have a natural ability to move even complex things forward in a structured way.
* You are a confident and kind communicator with excellent English skills.
* Previous experience from a multinational and/or fast-paced and/or complex stakeholder environment. Speed is part of our daily routine so we are looking for a person who thrives in such an environment.
* High attention to detail. We hope you have a straighforward way to ask questions, are a precise and thorough person with the ability to multitask and handle large amounts of information, tasks and details requiring your attention despite it getting hectic. Prioritization is definitely a skill to master where we all become better at it every day!
* You have a natural ability to figure things out as we take ownership beyond the obvious. This means you own tasks requiring your attention proactively with enthusiasm to constantly challenge yourself and us becoming better in what we do.
* Advanced skills in Google G Suite tools, Slack, Zoom and MS Office.


**Next Steps**
**Why you'll love working with us**
 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 You will fit into a truly diverse team across 27 countries - what matters to us is a caring and welcoming environment where we embrace uniqueness and celebrate diversity. Experience a company culture where we work on eye level, decisions are made quickly and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring, is on our daily agenda.
   

  

**What You’ll Get By Joining Us**
* Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional, in an international environment
* Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company
* Along with a competitive salary, you will also be eligible for our stock option plan


 If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:
   

  

 Orsi Kocsis, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - orsolya.kocsis@wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that
 **we do not accept applications sent by mail** 
 . You should submit your application through our careers website!
   

  

**About Wolt**
*Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants, and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants), and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 31 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.*
***So, why work at Wolt?***
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself, and being around friendly, humble, and ambitious people.
   

  

*We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*
***Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.*
*Join us today to build Wolt together.*

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
**Bring your best game to bringing the best people on board.**
 By creating desirable solutions and great experiences that enrich people’s daily lives and the health of our planet, we want to be a driving force in delivering enjoyable and sustainable living. We go to work every day determined to shape living for the better – for our customers and for the health of our planet.
   

  

 For that, we employ great people from a wide variety of backgrounds – not just because it’s the right thing to do, but also because we believe that diverse perspectives make our business stronger and more innovative. If you share our values, come find your place in our global community. Meet us on @lifeatelectrolux and career.electroluxgroup.com to learn more.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Partner to join our Talent Acquisition team Business Area Europe & APMEA at our Global HQ in Stockholm. You will be part of an international team of engaged Talent Acquisition Partners who advise our business managers on how to find, attract and assess talents that fit with our culture and organization.
   

  

 In this role your goal will be to act as a trusted advisor to the business and expert on the recruitment process and strategy in order to bring future business leaders and talented individuals into interesting positions for our HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 You will be the owner of the recruitment process, partnering with our Hiring Managers and People Business Partners across all business sectors and functions to fill our vacancies with the best candidates. You will drive the job requisition process in our ATS (Workday), write appealing job advertisements, identify the best candidates, and guide our Hiring Managers through our talent acquisition strategy and processes. You will share your market intel expertise with the hiring team so they can make informed decisions based on your input and advice. Additionally, you will play an active part in building talent strategy and create effective pipelining using our CRM (Phenom).
   

  

 With an emphasis on end-to-end recruitment, you will join our team effort in strengthening our Electrolux employer brand. We are open for you to bring your innovative way of working and thinking - continuous improvement is our mindset.
   

  

**Qualifications & Requirements:**
* Solid experience in recruiting. In-house experience is preferred, but agency/RPO background is also great, especially if you have done sourcing or executive level recruitment
* Excellent stakeholder management skills, confidence in building trusted and reliable relationships and taking full ownership for delivering results
* Expert in full cycle recruitment including, but not limited to sourcing, networking, assessing, legal, job analysis, salary trends, relationship management up to offer preparation and extension
* Proven track record in successfully navigating fast-paced, dynamic environments, including effective time management, ability to work independently, setting priorities and reliability at respecting deadlines
* Ability to anticipate issues and stay calm under pressure
* International mindset coming from working with various cultures and stakeholders at all levels
* Fluent Swedish and excellent business English knowledge
* Flexible approach to work and passion for Talent Acquisition are a must
* Digitally Savvy, MS Office literacy
* Experience working with Workday recruitment module and CRM Phenom would be a plus


**What we offer:**
* Work in a truly global company
* Interesting Continuous Improvement projects
* Opportunity to be part of both a Business and a People Community
* Be part of our vibrant Talent Acquisition BA Europe & APMEA team where teamship is in our DNA


**Where you will be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden). You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**PLEASE PROVIDE YOUR CV IN ENGLISH**
 As part of the Electrolux Group, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.
   

  

 At Electrolux, we take responsibility for our development in a supportive environment where we embrace our differences and learn from each other. In a truly multicultural setting, we shape living for the better and create remarkable experiences for employees and consumers, all around the globe.
   

  

**Electrolux Group** 
 is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world.
   

  

 For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Sales Commissions Manager
description:
We are Sinch. The world's #1 in mobile engagement, helping amazing companies communicate with customers. And whether or not you know us you've definitely used our technology. From the life-changing to the time-saving, we're helping over 3,000 businesses interact with people like never before. We reach every phone on the planet within seconds, so imagine the scale, the variety, the opportunity, and the growth that offers. Here you'll dream even bigger than ever, face fascinating challenges, and build your skills and career alongside amazing experts. And every time you hear a phone ping, you'll be proud of knowing you were part of making that happen.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand the team with a Sales Commissions Manager to chase the dream with us.
   

  

**The essence of the role**
 Global Sales Incentives and Compensation team in Sinch is looking for an experienced Sales Commissions Manager to join our dynamic team. The person who will become part of our group will be responsible for sales commission calculation framework. In Sinch, Sales Commissions Manager is a role focused on creation, optimization, and coordination of E2E processes from quota setting, sales incentive plan issuance, commission calculations to commission pay-out. The role is part of Global Sales Incentives and Compensation team and is partnering with Sales, Finance, Revenue Operations, Legal and other stakeholders across Sinch Group.
   

  

 You will report to the Director of Sales Incentives and Compensation, who is based in EMEA.
   

  

**As a Sales Commissions Manager, You Will**
* Design and optimize sales commissioning E2E processes from quota setting, sales incentive plans issuance, commission calculations to commission pay-out.
* Be a reliable partner to various regional and global teams and stakeholders for anything related to sales commissions, calculations, SIP issuing etc.
* Work closely with regional RevOps and FP&A teams to harmonize, optimize, and create frameworks and processes around sales commissions.
* Ensure that sales commissions are calculated accurately and timely and report on the performance.
* Identify requirements and gaps in data, mechanics, metrics, calculation principles, drive improvements and ensure process efficiency.
* Design global governance framework, approval process, objection management and ensure compliance.
* Continuously evaluate and improve Sales commissioning processes and systems to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Work cross functionally internally to ensure strategic alignment and operational coordination between the various stakeholder teams: Sales Compensation, Sales, Revenue Operations, Finance, BI/Data, Partner, Marketing, Customer Success, Business IT etc.
* Foster a collaborative and results oriented culture.
* Champion our Sinch culture by embodying our core values and helping strengthen the company culture by being an inspiring role model.


**Requirements**
**Who are you?**
 This role requires strong project management and analytical skills, a deep understanding of sales commission frameworks, as well as solid knowledge of sales incentives and compensation.
   

  

**In order to be successful in this role, we believe you have:**
* Education: Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or related areas.
* Experience: 7+ years of relevant professional experience, running or being part of a Sales Commission team, FP&A, Sales Operations or Revenue Operations.
* Skills: Strong experience with sales compensation and commission principles, financial and business analysis. You have a high attention to detail; you are structured and able to analyse complex issues and propose creative solutions.
* Self-starter: You're a go-getter, able to work with little coordination, someone who takes the initiative and steers their work independently. You're not fazed by ambiguity, and you're all about turning the unknown into a clear path. You are able to manage multiple priorities and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Program Management: Your program management skills are advanced and enable you to coordinate medium to large projects involving data and data outcomes.
* Communication skills: Your verbal and written communication skills are top of the class. Capable of communicating sophisticated information in an easy-to-understand format. Able to interact comfortably with the multi-functional leadership.


 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English** 
 .
   

  

**Are you ready? Join us on our journey!**
**About The Recruitment Process**
*To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, experience, and attributes relevant to the role and Sinch will be assessed. As part of our recruitment process, pre-employment testing is used to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role. We acknowledge that there are two parties deciding in this process and welcome you to ask any questions you may have at any stage of the process.*

title: DevOps Expert
description:
**We are looking for a DevOps Expert for our client, you will be a member of the System Team – Responsible for driving LCM, CI/CD and Automation activities across the ART. Coordinating AD teams deliveries, and that of external parties, to ensure that they delivery on time and within budget.**


### **Requirements**


* Proven Project Management experience.
* Good understanding of the SDLC & ITIL.
* Nice to have TOGAF knowledge.
* Experience of implementing automation of processes and/or testing.

* Problem solving mindset.
* Good communicator.

title: Sr DevOps Engineer
description:
**This is Worldline**
Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.  


**The Opportunity**
We are seeking a versatile Software Engineer to join our Platform Engineering DevOps team, and work in a constantly evolving, dynamic, and agile environment, believing that the route to speed and stability is through automation. Teamwork, communication, and speaking your mind are of high importance to us, especially when they come with a curious mind, a willingness to grow, and exchange ideas and knowledge.  


In this role, along with a team of 8 members, you’ll set up AWS (Amazon Web Services) infrastructure which is handling millions of transactions worth billions of Euros. The team has a DevSecOps standpoint, owns, develops, and manages all Infrastructure as Code in AWS accounts, running 100s of containers and serverless functions; If you build it, you run it!  


If this looks exciting and you are eager to continue growing your professional capabilities with ongoing training and educational opportunities, come join us!  


**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**Delivering the committed objectives that include adapting to any new needs to reach the goal
* On-call duty according to a rotating schedule
* Participate in your team's day-to-day activities including tools development, operations, maintenance, and support
* Being an active member in our agile events like daily stand-ups, planning, retros, and demos. etc.
* Foster team spirit, quality and technical agility

  


**Who Are We Looking For**
We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
 You have proven experience in systems engineering, automating infrastructure creation & maintenance tasks using Docker, Jenkins, Terraform\ CloudFormation, etc.
* You have a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, distributed systems, software engineering, or another equivalent field
* You have relevant experience in supporting/operating transaction driven and highly available platforms running microservices with 99.99% uptime
* You have a curiosity about security solutions such as WAF, IDS/IPS, Anti-DDOS, and SIEM
* You have work experience in programming (Python scripting) and an interest in automation
* You are passionate about cloud services, pay attention to details, handle many different partners and you are accountable to deliver results in a fast-paced environment

  


**Perks & Benefits**
At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
* Being a part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide
* Health benefits contribution
* Health check – Every 2nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.

  


**Shape the evolution**
We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.  


**Learn more about life at Worldline at** **jobs.worldline.com**  


**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**  

#LI-Hybrid
